data.Name: Production-based carbon emissions
data.Definition: emissions related to the production process in the economy. This is carbon emitted from the burning of fossil fuels like coal and oil, and gas for energy production and industrial production of materials (such as cement, steel and other industrial processes in the country).

data.Name: Carbon productivity of the economy
data.Definition: amount of output (in GDP produced per unit of CO₂ emitted in the production process of the country). USD/kg of CO₂ emissions. The indicator provides an overview of how Uzbekistan is progressing in reducing carbon emissions from production, and it reflects the trends in the transition to a low-carbon economy. National data were not available to the authors on this indicator; the report uses OECD datasets.

data.Name: TPES
data.Definition:
energy input found in nature before transformation to final forms of energy for end-use (such as electricity or petrol for transport). It   includes non-renewables (coal, oil, natural gas), minerals and renewables (OWD, 2023).
Amount of energy supplied in the country in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

data.Name: Energy productivity
data.Definition: Income (in GDP) generated per unit of TPES in the process of production. GDP (in USD 2015) per toe energy use. The indicator measures the economic benefit of using a unit of primary energy. It indicates whether Uzbekistan is becoming more energy efficient and generating more output from a unit of energy consumption.

data.Name: Energy intensity
data.Definition: the ratio of primary energy consumption over GDP measured in constant US dollars. Energy intensity measures the amount of energy consumed per unit of GDP to identify how efficiently a country uses energy to produce a given amount of economic benefit. Total energy consumed per unit of GDP. This is the inverse of energy productivity and shows the rate of efficient energy use.

data.Name: Share of renewable energy supply
data.Definition: the proportion of primary energy generated from hydropower, solar, wind, biomass, waste, geothermal, wave and tidal sources. This indicator looks at the data on renewable energy technologies, their share of energy supply and how quickly the proportion changes. Percentage of renewable energy of total primary energy supplied TPES (in toe), million. The indicator helps measure the share of low-carbon   renewable energy sources in the total energy mix supplied/consumed in Uzbekistan.

data.Name: Share of renewables in electricity generation
data.Definition: the share of electricity generated from renewable sources of energy, including hydropower, solar, wind, biomass and geothermal sources. Percentage of renewable sources in total electricity generation. It helps show if Uzbekistan is progressing towards a low-carbon electric system.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: percentage of the total energy used by sectors (agricultural services, transport, industry). Percentage share of TPES consumed by the main sectors of the   economy. This indicator shows the trends in total energy use by sectors of the economy, identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: percentage of the total energy used by sectors (agricultural services, transport, industry). Percentage share of TPES consumed by the main sectors of the   economy. This indicator shows the trends in total energy use by sectors of the economy, identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: percentage of the total energy used by sectors (agricultural services, transport, industry). Percentage share of TPES consumed by the main sectors of the   economy. This indicator shows the trends in total energy use by sectors of the economy, identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: percentage of the total energy used by sectors (agricultural services, transport, industry). Percentage share of TPES consumed by the main sectors of the   economy. This indicator shows the trends in total energy use by sectors of the economy, identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: percentage of the total energy used by sectors (agricultural services, transport, industry). Percentage share of TPES consumed by the main sectors of the   economy. This indicator shows the trends in total energy use by sectors of the economy, identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Share of renewable energy supply
data.Definition: the proportion of primary energy generated from hydropower, solar, wind, biomass, waste, geothermal, wave and tidal sources. This indicator looks at the data on renewable energy technologies, their share of energy supply and how quickly the proportion changes. Percentage of renewable energy of total primary energy supplied TPES (in toe), million. The indicator helps measure the share of low-carbon   renewable energy sources in the total energy mix supplied/consumed in Uzbekistan.

data.Name: Domestic Material Consumption (DMC) productivity
data.Definition: output in the economy generated from using a unit of material materials biomass, non-metal and metal material resources (in terms of weight) used in an economy (i.e., materials extracted or harvested in the country, plus materials and products imported, minus material and products exported (OECD 2017). It measures the amount of material used in an economy.. GDP per unit of DMC. The indicator measures how much income is generated per unit of DMC (biomass, metal and non-metal materials) in the economy. Uzbekistan does not consolidate data on this indicator.

data.Name: Water productivity
data.Definition: measures how much output is produced in monetary terms per unit of freshwater withdrawn. Value-added in GDP (2015 USD) per cubic metre of abstracted water. It shows whether the country is using its water resources efficiently.

data.Name: Fertiliser use
data.Definition: the quantity of plant nutrients used per unit of arable land. Fertiliser products cover nitrogenous, potash and phosphate fertilisers. Amount of fertiliser applied per ha of agricultural land (kg/ha). This GGI measures the nutrient balances in agriculture for the two main fertilisers applied on farms – nitrogen (N) and phosphorus (P). However, mapping the annual nutrient balance for Uzbekistan is not possible due   to the absence of data to calculate the value. This report alternately shows the total fertiliser use in Uzbekistan compared to the world average. It also shows “excess nitrogen” – nitrogen lost to the environment.

data.Name: Household solid waste
data.Definition: waste originating from households and collected by municipalities. Total solid waste generated by households in a year. The SA started collecting such data on SW generated and recycled since 2016 as part of SDG monitoring. Percentage recycled out of solid waste generated.

data.Name: Renewable freshwater resources flow
data.Definition: internal river flows and surface water from rainfall in the country. This flow is both permanent and seasonal surface water, including inflows from neighboring countries. The amount of freshwater in billion m3 that Uzbekistan withdraws annually for different purposes.

data.Name: Water stress
data.Definition: water withdrawal intensity. The level of water stress can show the degree to which the country exploits its water resources to meet water demand. This measures water withdrawal as a percentage of available water resources.  The SA also reports on this indicator as part of the clean water goal.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: the share of the total land area covered by forest. Forest resources are essential in regulating climate, protecting biodiversity and providing ecosystem services. Forest area (million hectares) percentage forest area as a share of total land area. The  indicator shows if Uzbekistan has experienced afforestation or massive deforestation over the years.

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: the share of the total land area covered by forest. Forest resources are essential in regulating climate, protecting biodiversity and providing ecosystem services. Forest area (million hectares) percentage forest area as a share of total land area. The  indicator shows if Uzbekistan has experienced afforestation or massive deforestation over the years.

data.Name: Forest stock
data.Definition: a stock of standing trees in forest areas with a certain diameter at breast height, measured in cubic metres (FAO). It is the volume over the bark of all living trees with a minimum diameter of 10 cm at breast height, including the stem from ground level up to a top diameter of 0 cm (excluding branches) (OECD). The indicator provides information about wood resources measured in millions of cubic metres (m3). It also provides the basis for estimating the amount of CO₂ the forest contains.

data.Name: Land area
data.Definition: the FAO and World Bank databases define a land area as a country’s area, excluding area under inland water bodies (rivers and lakes). Uzbekistan follows a similar definition. Land resources are critical for food production, biodiversity conservation and carbon sequestration. Land includes natural and semi-natural vegetated land, bare land, cropland and artificial (built-up) surfaces. The indicator measures the inhabitable area of the country (km2), including the agriculture and forest area.

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the share of land area that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures (World Bank). This measures the percentage of land area available for agriculture (crops, orchards and pasture) in km2.

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the share of land area that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures (World Bank). This measures the percentage of land area available for agriculture (crops, orchards and pasture) in km2.

data.Name: Cultivated (arable) land
data.Definition: part of the agricultural land that is cultivated annually (arable land) for growing food and feed. Percentage of agriculture land cultivated for annual crops.

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas produced and consumed annually.

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas produced and consumed annually.

data.Name: Protected areas
data.Definition: national parks, nature reserves and wildlife sanctuaries designated by national authorities as scientific reserves with limited public access. Area (ha) and percentage of land area protected from open access to human activities.

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable species i.e., those plants and animals in danger of extinction or soon likely to be. Number of species (animal and plant) threatened by extinction among species assessed or known. The Ministry of Ecology, Environment Protection and Climate Change takes inventory periodically and publishes in the “Red Book”. The 5th edition was published in 2019.

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable species i.e., those plants and animals in danger of extinction or soon likely to be. Number of species (animal and plant) threatened by extinction among species assessed or known. The Ministry of Ecology, Environment Protection and Climate Change takes inventory periodically and publishes in the “Red Book”. The 5th edition was published in 2019.

data.Name: Annual mean temperature
data.Definition: annual mean surface temperature expressed in degree Celsius (°C).

data.Name: Air pollution
data.Definition: The Statistics Agency (SA) provides the amount of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere in thousand tonnes of pollutants per year.

data.Name: Population exposure to air pollution by PM:
data.Definition: the proportion of the population exposed to outdoor air pollution concentration of average PM2.5 to which a typical resident is exposed throughout a year (derived from satellite observation or ground monitoring and measured in μg/m³). This report shows the proportion of the population living in areas with annual concentrations exceeding the value of 35μg/m³. Percentage of the population exposed to air pollution    above the average concentration of 35µg/m3 of air pollution.

data.Name: Population exposure to air pollution by PM
data.Definition: the proportion of the population exposed to outdoor air pollution concentration of average PM2.5 to which a typical resident is exposed throughout a year (derived from satellite observation or ground monitoring and measured in μg/m³). This report shows the proportion of the population living in areas with annual concentrations exceeding the value of 35μg/m³. Percentage of the population exposed to air pollution    above the average concentration of 35µg/m3 of air pollution.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Mortality from exposure to PM2.5 in deaths per million inhabitants.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: The indicator monitors the mortality induced by exposure to ozone gas pollution, which causes lung problems and premature death. Outdoor workers in areas with high ozone levels are at the most risk.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs due to exposure to ozone in  GDP equivalent percentage points.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs due to exposure to ozone in  GDP equivalent percentage points.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs from mortality due to exposure to lead in GDP equivalent percentage points.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: The indicator monitors the mortality induced by exposure to ozone gas pollution, which causes lung problems and premature death. Outdoor workers in areas with high ozone levels are at the most risk.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: In percentage of all deaths. The SA has published this indicator since 2017.

data.Name: Share of households with access to safe drinking water
data.Definition: households using improved drinking water sources, which include piped water into dwellings, yards or plots, public taps or standpipes, boreholes, or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, packaged water, delivered water and rainwater. Improved water sources should be located on the premises, available when needed and contamination-free. The indicator constitutes a key component in measuring the environmental quality of life (OECD, 2017). It measures the proportion (percentage) of households with access to safe drinking water sources not shared with other houses. The SA collects data on percentage of houses with access to safe drinking water as part of SDG-6 monitoring.

data.Name: Share of households with access to sewerage treatment
data.Definition: Percentage of households connected to public sewerage treatment.  Households connected to an urban wastewater collecting system through public sewerage network. Individual private treatment facilities such as septic tanks are not covered. The SA collects data on this indicator.

data.Name: Population using improved sanitation
data.Definition: Percentage of the population using improved sanitation facilities with basic handwashing facilities and toilets, including flush or pour-flush toilets to sewerage systems, septic tanks, or pit latrines, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab and composting toilets. This indicator measures the proportion of the population with access to basic sanitation services (e.g., hand washing).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations
data.Definition: environment-related inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies. Percentage share of environment-related inventions of all domestic technologies. The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT) (OECD, 2017:153).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations
data.Definition: environment-related inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies. Percentage share of environment-related inventions of all domestic technologies. The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT) (OECD, 2017:153).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations:
data.Definition: environment-related inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies. Percentage share of environment-related inventions of all domestic technologies. The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT) (OECD, 2017:153).

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: public budget for environmental protection. E.g., environmental research and development in renewable energy sources. Percentage of total GDP, government expenditure on green growth (GG). This measures how much the government invests in green initiatives. Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change MEEPCCh, 2012-19 Ministry of Economy and Finance

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: public budget for environmental protection. E.g., environmental research and development in renewable energy sources. Percentage of total GDP, government expenditure on green growth (GG). This measures how much the government invests in green initiatives. Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change MEEPCCh, 2012-19 Ministry of Economy and Finance

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: public budget for environmental protection. E.g., environmental research and development in renewable energy sources. Percentage of total GDP, government expenditure on green growth (GG). This measures how much the government invests in green initiatives. Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change MEEPCCh, 2012-19 Ministry of Economy and Finance

data.Name: Environment-related tax revenues
data.Definition: income collected by the government through environment-related taxes. Taxes can include (i) energy products for transport purposes (petrol and diesel); (ii) motor vehicles and transport (one-off import or sales taxes, recurrent taxes on registration or road use and other transport taxes); (iii) waste management); (iv) emissions of pollutants and (v) other. In this report, only pollution tax and waste management are tracked. Percentage of total tax revenue. The indicator measures a payment based on the quantity of pollutants discharged into the environment e.g. energy-related or transport-related.
data.Source: Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change (new name) MEEPCCh, 2015-18

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the energy sector to keep prices low. For example, coal, gas and electricity. It measures how much the government subsidises fossil fuels and the extent of support for renewable energy. Percentage of total subsidies (for coal, gas, electric). The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to energy production sectors. IEA, 2010-20

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the energy sector to keep prices low. For example, coal, gas and electricity. It measures how much the government subsidises fossil fuels and the extent of support for renewable energy. Percentage of total subsidies (for coal, gas, electric). The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to energy production sectors. IEA, 2010-20

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the energy sector to keep prices low. For example, coal, gas and electricity. It measures how much the government subsidises fossil fuels and the extent of support for renewable energy. Percentage of total subsidies (for coal, gas, electric). The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to energy production sectors.

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Real price per litre for diesel and petrol (in USD 2015) using purchasing power parity (PPP) OECD, 2012-21

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Nominal price of petrol in USD using exchange rate of the Commercial bank of Uzbekistan.

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Nominal price of petrol in USD using exchange rate of the Commercial bank of Uzbekistan.

data.Name: Price per kWh of electricity
data.Definition: The indicator measures changes in the end-user price for electricity (residential and industry use), using 2015 price as base year. The dynamics in the energy tariffs over time show policy reforms for valuing energy sources.

data.Name: Price per kWh of electricity
data.Definition: The indicator measures changes in the end-user price for electricity (residential and industry use), using 2015 price as base year. The dynamics in the energy tariffs over time show policy reforms for valuing energy sources.

data.Name: Real GDP
data.Definition: gross domestic product of Uzbekistan calculated at constant prices

data.Name: GDP per capita
data.Definition: average annual income of the people in Uzbekistan (annual real GDP     divided by the annual population number). Real GDP per population in UZS is the ratio of real GDP to the annual permanent population, UZS/person. Authors’ calculation using SA data 2011-22.

data.Name: Real GDP
data.Definition: gross domestic product of Uzbekistan calculated at constant prices

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage shares of value added in GDP by categories of main economic sectors in Uzbekistan: agriculture, industry and services

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage shares of value added in GDP by categories of main economic sectors in Uzbekistan: agriculture, industry and services

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage shares of value added in GDP by categories of main economic sectors in Uzbekistan: agriculture, industry and services

data.Name: CPI
data.Definition: an indicator that shows changes in prices of goods and services over time consumed by the population in Uzbekistan. It shows the changes in the value of inflation in the economy for a fixed set of consumer goods and services.  It is annual percentage change in the price of a basket of commodities based on SA calculation of price data in the consumer market. This report uses the percentage change as of December of the previous year.

data.Name: Export and import values of goods and services in million USD. Export:
data.Definition: transaction of goods and services from Uzbekistan to a foreign state in monetary value.

data.Name: Export and import values of goods and services in million USD. Import:
data.Definition: transaction of goods and services from a foreign state to Uzbekistan in monetary value.

data.Name: Share of low-income population
data.Definition: the share of the population below income estimates of 2 100 kilocalories per day, as recommended by the World Bank. It shows the percentage of the population with income less than a given amount. The SA collects data on the indicator through household surveys. However, it calculates the poverty rate as of 2021 using different measurement methods

data.Name: Gini coefficient
data.Definition: an index between 0 and 1 based on the comparison of cumulative proportions of the population against cumulative proportions of income they receive. Index number. The coefficient ranges between 0 in the case of perfect income equality and 1 in the case of perfect   income inequality.

data.Name: Labor force
data.Definition: the proportion of the population aged 15 and older that is economically active during a specified period.

data.Name: Employment
data.Definition: persons of working age engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period or not at work due to temporary absence from a job or working-time arrangement. The employment rate here in the report is a proportion (percentage) of the labour force employed.

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: Percentage of total employment by main sectors of the economy.

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: Percentage of total employment by main sectors of the economy.

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: Percentage of total employment by main sectors of the economy.

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population     of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Percentage of total candidates enrolled in schools at primary secondary and tertiary levels.

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population     of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Percentage of total candidates enrolled in schools at primary secondary and tertiary levels.

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population     of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Percentage of total candidates enrolled in schools at primary secondary and tertiary levels.

data.Name: Total population
data.Definition: number of people permanently living in the country at the beginning of the year, regardless of legal status or citizenship. Number of people permanently living in Uzbekistan at the beginning of the year.

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life. Average number of years, showing premature death.

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life. Average number of years, showing premature death.

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life. Average number of years, showing premature death.

data.Name: Net external migration
data.Definition: the net total of migrants during the period (i.e. the number of immigrants minus the number of emigrants, including citizens and noncitizens). Net migration is the net total of migrants during the period, that is, the number of immigrants minus the number of emigrants, including both citizens and noncitizens.
